src:
Sayembara Ratusan Juta demi Temukan Penyelam China di Selat Sunda
05 Nov 2019, 21:32 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Tiga penyelam warga negara China yang hilang di Pulau Sangiang, Banten, belum ditemukan. Keluarga salah satu korban hilang menggelar sayembara berhadiah Rp 750 juta untuk pencarian para penyelam.
Jamie, kerabat korban hilang Tian Yu, membenarkan selebaran sayembara berhadiah Rp 750 juta bagi penemu kerabatnya.
"Iya benar, sama yang di bawahnya ada di posisi gambar itu orangnya semua ada di dalam," kata Jamie saat dimintai konfirmasi, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Jamie menegaskan dirinya hanya memberikan hadiah bagi penemu kerabatnya bernama Tian Yu. Penemu korban diminta melakukan konfirmasi ke posko SAR gabungan di dermaga 2 Pelabuhan Merak.
"Karena kemarin kan ada 3 orang yang hilang di Pulau Sangiang. Yang saya bicara ini ada yang satu orang ya," ujarnya.
Tian Yu dan dua penyelam China lainnya hilang diduga terbawa arus pada Minggu (3/11).
Ketiga WNA itu berangkat dari Pantai Mabak di Merak bersama 4 temannya pada Minggu (3/11) pagi. Setelah sampai di Pulau Sangiang, mereka menyelam untuk menikmati keindahan bawah laut.
Mereka yang melakukan penyelaman berjumlah 6 orang dibagi dalam dua tim, masing-masing 3 orang. Tim pertama berhasil muncul ke permukaan. Namun, tim kedua hilang terbawa arus meski sempat muncul juga ke permukaan.
text:
Hundreds of Million Contests to Find Chinese Divers in the Sunda Strait
05 Nov 2019, 21:32 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Three Chinese divers lost on Sangiang Island, Banten, have not been found. The family of one of the missing victims held a Rp. 750 million contest to search for divers.
Jamie, a relative of the missing victim Tian Yu, confirmed the contest flyer with a prize of Rp. 750 million for the inventor of his relatives.
"Yes, it's true, the same one underneath is in the position of the picture, the people are all inside," Jamie said when asked for confirmation on Tuesday (5/11/2019).
Jamie emphasized that he only gave a gift to the inventor of his relative named Tian Yu. The victim's inventor was asked to confirm to the combined SAR post at dock 2 of the Merak Port.
"Because yesterday there were 3 people missing on Sangiang Island. What I'm talking about is one person," he said.
Tian Yu and two other Chinese divers disappeared, allegedly drifting on Sunday (3/11).
The three foreigners departed from Mabak Beach in Merak with 4 friends on Sunday (3/11) morning. After arriving at Sangiang Island, they dive to enjoy the underwater beauty.
Those who do dives amounted to 6 people divided into two teams, each 3 people. The first team successfully surfaced. However, the second team was lost with the current even though it had also surfaced.
